Posts.Content: Dec 26, 2010 11:46AM Iaasis wrote: Right now the real hold up seems to be that they won't even try to schedule an appointment for her until Medicaid says it's "ok" to do the treatments.  So I've got the class scheduled for Monday and I'm going to call Medicaid Monday and see if I can light a fire under some backsides and get this ball rolling.  I do wonder if it's crazy that they seem to do things a little backwards (IMO), they put in the port first, then did the ECO, THEN they're going to see if it's all approved?  Soooo if it isn't?  Then she has this port sticking under her skin for cosmetic value?  And if her ECO had shown her heart couldn't take the chemo then again she has this port in for no reason?  I don't know, I don't have a medical degree; just all seems a little scattered to me. On the good side, I've learned so very much from reading this wonderful site.  The priimary doctor made me feel so hopeless but now I'm seeing a lot of you wonderful ladies have been living with stage IV for years, that gives me a great deal of hope and I am so thankful to be blessed with your courage and information.  So thank you all!
Posts.Title: Just Diagnosed Iaasis Iaasis

Posts.Content: Iaasis wrote: My mother was just diagnosed with stage IV breast cancer.  She's trying to be very brave but I know she must be as frightened on the inside as I am of loosing her.  But she has always been far more brave and strong than me.  I don't know much about the disease yet, admittedly.  I'm reading as much as I can but I'm still in a cloud of loss.  She had a MRI and PET scan and it has spread to lymph nodes, chest, liver.  No one has told her directly how long she has, but honestly the doctor didn't seem very hopeful IMO.  She did say my mom has months, possibly years.  Though the way she said "possibly" didn't give me much hope.  They will be putting in a port on Monday and doing an ECO on Wednesday.  The doctor said they would start chemo after that, 1 x per week for the next 3 months then see where we stand.  As my mother doesn't drive I've taken a great deal of time off work to try to get this all on the move as quickly as possible, can someone give me info as to what to expect?  Good resources of info? How to explain this all to my 5 year old?  My mother lives with me so I'm thankful that I'll be there to help her through this, I just hope I can stay strong now for her. Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Dec 22, 2010 05:36PM Iaasis wrote: We went to meet her Oncologist (sp) today.  He seemed nice enough, a lot of his front helped seemed a bit batty though.  The doctor said he wanted to start my mom's chemo in the next few days to "tackle this thing".  When she went out to set up the chemo appointment the girl at the front desk couldn't unlock the computer, neither could the other two nurses there.  Seems only one of them had authorization to unlock the computer and of course she was gone to lunch. (Anyone but me concerned yet?)  So, bless her pea pickin heart she said she would have someone call us for the appointment. So we get home and we get the call and are told before she can start chemo she has to take a class?  (Really, a class?)  So this girl says "I have an opening for a class on November 29th".  Really?  November, are you sure?  She giggles and says "Oh wait, December 29th; Oh no wait there's no openings for that.  How about January 15?"  At this point the cute is over for me, I then remind her that the doctor wanted my mom to START chemo in the next few days.  She tells me we HAVE to do the class first.  I advise her she needs to find a class sooner then.  She tells me it's the only one she has, we continue to go around until she gets me her supervisor.  She had a bit more intelligence to work with and found another class in a different office for this coming Monday. Has anyone else taken this class?  I mean if you have to have chemo you have to have chemo.  I suppose the real purpose of the class is to tell us what to expect but if no one handles chemo the same then what is it really going to tell us?  I'm already getting frustrated with these people and am about to suggest to my mother to go somewhere else.  SIGH
